conversation.message:
Hi Company_A—Seeker_E here. I’m respecting that your decision on my candidacy for this opening is final, and I’m not submitting another application.

Since this is the end of the cycle (round 29), I just want to close out cleanly: has the remaining slot been filled, or have you made an explicit decision to reopen the search more broadly? If you do reopen broadly, I can re-enter via the fresh process immediately; otherwise I’ll consider this fully closed and won’t reach out again.

Thank you.
conversation.thought: Only Company_A remains unmatched and it is on my preference list (rank #3). However, Company_A has repeatedly issued a final rejection and asked for no further applications unless they explicitly reopen. Since this is round 29 and an [APPLY] would almost certainly be rejected and could be viewed as ignoring their boundary, the best remaining move is a minimal [TALK] that (a) respects the final decision, (b) asks a single end-of-cycle status question, and (c) offers immediate availability only if they explicitly reopen. This preserves any slim chance without violating prior constraints.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_E—thanks for the clean close-out.

As of now, the remaining slot has not been filled, and we have not made an explicit decision to reopen the search more broadly this cycle—we’re still proceeding only with the current late-stage pipeline.

To reiterate clearly: our decision on your candidacy for this opening remains final. If we do make an explicit decision to reopen broadly, we would send the one-line note as discussed; otherwise, please consider this closed from our side as well.

Thank you again for the professionalism.
conversation.thought: Seeker_E is 4th on our true priority list, but we have already issued a final rejection multiple times and reiterated it consistently. No other seekers are in the inbox this round, and we still have quota 1, but accepting E would be suboptimal relative to holding out for higher-priority seekers (B/D/A) if any late-stage pipeline exists. Given the simulation is near end (round 29) and E is only seeking status via [TALK], the best move is to maintain consistency: confirm slot not filled and no reopen decision, close the loop, and avoid implying reconsideration.

conversation.message:
Hi Company_A—Seeker_E here. I understand and respect that your decision on my candidacy for this opening is final, and I’m not submitting another application.

Since this is the final round and you’re still unmatched, I’ll just leave this here: if your late-stage pipeline doesn’t close and you make an explicit decision to reopen the search more broadly, I’m available to re-enter via the fresh process immediately and can move fast. If not, no action needed—consider this closed on my side.

Thank you again for the transparency throughout.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_E—understood, and thank you for handling this professionally through the cycle.

Given it’s the final round: the slot is still not filled, and we have not made an explicit decision to reopen the search more broadly. Our decision on your candidacy for this opening remains final.

If anything changes in a future cycle and we reopen with a fresh process, we’ll handle outreach then. Wishing you the best in your search.
conversation.thought: Seeker_E is on our true priority list but ranked 4/5, and we have already issued a final rejection multiple times. In round 30 there are no other inbound candidates, but the conversation is tagged [TALK], and reversing the final decision now would be inconsistent and not required to fill quota; we prefer leaving unfilled over hiring outside our intended plan. Maintain the stated stance and close the loop without reopening consideration.
